title: Puerto Rico - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 3 February 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, two men in a car were shot and killed by gunmen travelling in a car (drive-by) in Hato Rey. 2 fatalities.
On 2 February 2021, on the road from Carolina to San Juan, Carolina, gunmen in a moving car shot at another car (drive-by). Four people including two children were injured. No fatalities.
On 2 February 2021, in Toa Alta, Toa Alta, unknown individuals shot at police officers in the Ramon Perez Rodriguez area. One officer was hit and injured. No fatalities.

On 1 February 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of non-teacher employees of the University of Puerto Rico protested in front of the Department of Labor against a collective bargaining agreement that the university offered. The agreement included a clause which allowed the University to unilaterally cancel the agreement. [size=no report]
On 29 January 2021, in Fajardo, Fajardo, gunmen shot and killed a man from a moving car (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, a man was killed in a clandestine bar in the Santurce neighbourhood. Police seized various firearms and drugs in the victim's house and in the bar. 1 fatality.
Around 23 January 2021 (as reported), in Catano, Catano, a man was killed. Firefighters found his charred body in a burning car in the Palmas neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 23 January 2021, in Toa Baja, Toa Baja, several gunmen shot and killed a man in Palo Seco. Another man was also injured in the shooting. 1 fatality.
Around 22 January 2021 (month of), in Canovanas, Canovanas, a man was killed. His decomposing body was found partially burned and with the hands tied behind the back next to the highway. 1 fatality.
Around 22 January 2021 (as reported), in Cidra, Cidra, a man was killed. His gagged body was later found with the hands tied and a single bullet wound in the Hondura neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 21 January 2021, in Catano, Catano, two gunmen shot and killed a person on Avenida Flor de Valle. 1 fatality.
Labour Group (Puerto Rico); Taxi/Bus Drivers (Puerto Rico)

On 19 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, taxi drivers, truckers and crane operators protested in front of the capitol building. The protesters gathered against a proposed tax hike and a change in the allocation of taxi fare. [size=no report]
On 18 January 2021, in Caguas, Caguas, armed men in a car opened fire on a woman driving on the PR-30 highway (drive-by). The woman was unharmed. No fatalities.
On 18 January 2021, in Arroyo, Arroyo, gunmen in a moving car opened fire on a man in another car on the PR-3 highway (drive-by). He was injured. No fatalities.
Around 15 January 2021 (as reported), in Aguas Buenas, Aguas Buenas, a man was killed and his gagged body was later found in the Mulas neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 14 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, a man opened fire on police officers in the Puerto Nuevo area. The man was arrested with a large quantity of drugs. No fatalities.
FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera

On 12 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, a suspect in the killing of three police officers a day earlier was found dead in Santurce with a message next to his body. According to police, the victim was a member of the FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera drug trafficking group, and was linked to the killing of a woman in October 2020. 1 fatality.
Around 11 January 2021 (month of), in Juana Diaz, Juana Diaz, a man was killed and his burnt body was found in an advanced state of decomposition in the Guayacanes sector. 1 fatality.
On 11 January 2021, in Fajardo, Fajardo, gunmen opened fire from a car (drive-by), killing one person and injuring two others. 1 fatality.
FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera

On 11 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, a gunman in a car shot and killed three police officers who were chasing him after he got into an accident. The man got away and a day later his body was found. It is reported that the man was a member of the FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera and was linked to the killing of a woman in October 2020. 3 fatalities.

On 10 January 2021, in San Juan, San Juan, retirees and people from various labour unions drove in a caravan of more than 400 vehicles from the University of Puerto Rico to the residence of the governor to protest against a debt adjustment plan and in favour of a legislative proposal setting retirement plans. [size=more than 400]
On 9 January 2021, in Trujillo Alto, Trujillo Alto, a transsexual individual was shot and killed by unknown assailants. The attack might have been a hate crime. 1 fatality.
On 6 January 2021, in Vega Baja, Vega Baja, a gunman in a car opened fire on a man in Caparra Terrace (drive-by), injuring him. No fatalities.
On 6 January 2021, in Villalba, Villalba, gunmen in a car opened fire on a group of people, injuring two (drive-by). No fatalities.
On 23 December 2020, in Catano, Catano, gunmen on motorcycles opened fire on a car in the Bahia neighbourhood, killing a person inside (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 22 December 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, law students protested with banners to ask for clemency in the case of a girl, who is being charged with the killing of her brother. [size=no report]
On 20 December 2020, in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, several gunmen opened fire on a car, killing two individuals traveling inside. In the car, an AK47 and a handgun were found. 2 fatalities.
On 15 December 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen opened fire on a car from a moving vehicle, killing the man inside (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 10 December 2020, in Carolina, Carolina, two men walked up to a man playing basketball and shot him dead. 1 fatality.

On 8 December 2020, in Barceloneta, Barceloneta, a man with a rifle opened fire on a police patrol in the Seboruco neighbourhood, injuring two officers. The man himself was shot by police. No fatalities.
On 5 December 2020, in Naguabo, Naguabo, a man was killed and his body was partially burned. 1 fatality.
On 4 December 2020, in San Lorenzo, San Lorenzo, several gunmen shot and injured a man in the Santa Clara neighbourhood. No fatalities.
On 29 November 2020, in Naranjito, Naranjito, three men in a car opened fire at an apartment (drive-by). Nobody was injured. No fatalities.
On 29 November 2020, in Rio Grande, Rio Grande, a gunman fired shots at a woman from a moving car (drive-by). Nobody was hit. No fatalities.
On 29 November 2020, in Caguas, Caguas, several individuals walked up to a man sitting in a car and shot him, injuring him. No fatalities.
On 20 November 2020, in San German, San German, gunmen in a car opened fire on another car (drive-by) in the Duey neighbourhood. One man was injured. No fatalities.
On 18 November 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, several gunmen shot and killed a man who served prison time and was released on a federal conviction of arms smuggling. 1 fatality.
On 17 November 2020, in Mayaguez, Mayaguez, several individuals blocked a man who tried to drive away in his van, and shot him several times. 1 fatality.
Around 11 November 2020 (as reported), in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, a person was killed. His charred body was later found in an abandoned house. 1 fatality.

On 10 November 2020, in Canovanas, Canovanas, a man who was out on probation for a drug trafficking conviction was ambushed by several men with assault rifles and shot dead in the La Central neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 10 November 2020, in Caguas, Caguas, two armed individuals shot at a store, injuring two people. No fatalities.
On 6 November 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, unknown individuals opened fire on police officers at an intersection. None of the officers were injured. No fatalities.
Around 5 November 2020 (as reported), in Guayanilla, Guayanilla, a man was killed. His body was found gagged in the Pasto neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 4 November 2020, in Aguadilla, Aguadilla, three men attacked a man with a baseball bat. No fatalities.
On 4 November 2020, in Arecibo, Arecibo, armed men shot at a woman from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting. The woman was injured in her leg. No fatalities.

On 4 November 2020, in Mayaguez, Mayaguez, several armed men shot and killed a man in the parking lot of a hardware store. The victim had an electronic ankle bracelet to avoid him preventive prison. 1 fatality.

On 2 November 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen shot a man in a car in a drive-by shooting in the Monacillos neighbourhood. The man was killed and a woman who was in the car with him was injured. Police found a firearm in the victim's vehicle. 1 fatality.
On 2 November 2020, in Naguabo, Naguabo, gunmen shot and killed a man on the highway in the Rio Blanco neighbourhood. Three men were arrested for the shooting. 1 fatality.

On 2 November 2020, in Ponce municipality, Ponce, unknown individuals linked to drug trafficking were involved in several shootings throughout the night. No fatalities or injuries are reported, and no arrests were made. It is estimated that more than a hundred shots were fired. One shooting took place in the Portuguese village, one in El Paraiso, one in Cangrejo and one in Juana Diaz. No fatalities.
On 24 October 2020, in Manati, Manati, a group of people assaulted a man who was wanted for gender violence. He was taken to a doctor and then arrested. [size=no report]
On 24 October 2020, in Mayaguez, Mayaguez, various armed men opened fire from a car (drive-by), hitting a man and a woman and injuring them both. No fatalities.
On 18 October 2020, in Cidra, Cidra, a number of gunmen opened fire at a man from a quadbike in a drive-by shooting. The man was killed. 1 fatality.
On 18 October 2020, in Guayama, Guayama, three men were in a car when a car pulled up and several armed men came out and opened fire on them. All three were wounded. No fatalities.
FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera
FARC: Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cantera

On 18 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, hitmen killed a woman in the Hato Rey neighbourhood by shooting at her from a car in a drive-by shooting. According to the authorities the gunmen belonged to the FARC drug trafficking group. The victim is an Instagram influencer who was out on bail pending trial at the time of the shooting after having been charged with being a part of the FARC group herself. The FARC leader allegedly told her to stay away from his territory, which is thought to be the reason for the killing. The man who was in the car with the victim at the time of the shooting survived. 1 fatality.

On 14 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, about 60 people blocked the Las Americas highway to protest against potential US-statehood for Puerto Rico ahead of the referendum of November 6. [size=about 60]
On 14 October 2020, in Naguabo, Naguabo, several masked gunmen opened fire and killed two men who were out on parole in a drive-by shooting. 2 fatalities.
On 14 October 2020, in Toa Baja, Toa Baja, gunmen opened fire from a car, targeting another car in a drive-by shooting. One woman was killed and the driver was injured. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, between 15 to 20 women's right defenders protested outside the premises of the Office of the Procurator for Women in Hato Rey to demand that a state of emergency would be declared over a string of recent femicides that occurred this year. [size=between 15 to 20]
On 12 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, two men were killed in a car-to-car shootout on the PR-60 highway near the Las Piedras neighbourhood. 2 fatalities.

On 12 October 2020, in Canovanas, Canovanas, three armed men opened fire and targeted a car driven by an off-duty officer. The officer's car was hit, as well as a bystander who was injured. No fatalities.
On 11 October 2020, in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, gunmen opened fire on a house from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting. The neighbour was shot fatally, and two others were injured. 1 fatality.
On 9 October 2020, near Gurabo, Gurabo, a car-to-car shootout took place on the highway in which one man died. 1 fatality.
On 9 October 2020, in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, two cars blocked the road. When a man drove past, armed men opened fire, injuring him. No fatalities.

On 9 October 2020, in Ponce, Ponce, gunmen opened fire on a group of people on a basketball field, killing four and injuring two. One of the victims was wearing a mask and had with him multiple weapons. Police are looking into the possibility that the shooting was related to an arms or drug deal gone wrong. 4 fatalities.
On 8 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, a transgender woman was stabbed and injured by three individuals in her house in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood. No fatalities.
On 8 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, two armed men opened fire on police during a chase in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood. Police returned fire, killing both men. 2 fatalities.
On 6 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, three gunmen shot and killed a man in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 6 October 2020, in Villalba, Villalba, various gunmen shot and killed a woman while she was driving home from work. The gunmen chased her on a quadbike and shot more than 100 times. 1 fatality.
On 4 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, dozens of protesters gathered on World Animal Day to ask that the Mayaguez Zoo be closed. [size=dozens]
On 3 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of protesters demanded the reopening of schools. Schools have been closed to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 1 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, a woman was shot by a man on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting. The shooter missed her. No fatalities.
On 1 October 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, a gunman in a car shot at a man in another car in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

Around 30 September 2020 (as reported), in San German, San German, a transgender woman was killed and her body was found with several gunshot wounds. The motive of the killing remained to be determined. 1 fatality.
Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

On 28 September 2020, off the coast of San Juan, San Juan, the US Coast Guard intercepted over 1700kg of cocaine that was being smuggled on a go-fast ship. The ship also had 28kg of amphetamines and barrels of fuel on board.

On 27 September 2020, in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, pensioners protested in front of the Univision office to ask that candidates in the upcoming elections sign a document agreeing to prevent further pension cuts. [size=no report]
On 22 September 2020, in Guaynabo, Guaynabo, a shootout between the occupants of two cars resulted in one person being killed. 1 fatality.
On 22 September 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, two men in a car were intercepted by another car. The occupants of the other car then opened fire in a drive-by shooting, killing one person. 1 fatality.

Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), in Tabonuco, Sabana Grande, a man was killed and his body was found in a ravine with a sheet over his head and his hands and feet bound with adhesive tape. 1 fatality.
On 15 September 2020, in Ponce, Ponce, armed men shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.
Around 15 September 2020 (as reported), in Carolina, Canovanas, a person was killed and the body was later recovered from a burning vehicle in Canovanillas neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

On 15 September 2020, off the coast of Vieques, officers of the Customs and Border Patrol of the US detected a suspicious ship about 75 nautical miles traveling towards the islands. They intercepted the ship and nearly 4000kg of cocaine was found on board. Two Americans were arrested.
Around 12 September 2020 (as reported), outside of Canovanas, Canovanas, a man was killed and his body was found in a burning car that bore bullet holes and was found along the highway. 1 fatality.
On 8 September 2020, in Canaboncito, Caguas, several armed men in a car opened fire on a horse merchant who was riding his horse, killing him. The horse died as well. 1 fatality.
On 2 September 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, two men in a car drove up to a man. One of them got out of the car and shot him. No fatalities.
Police Forces of the United States (2017-) Drug Enforcement Administration
On 2 September 2020, in Guayabal, Juana Diaz, US DEA officers got in a shootout with armed men, wounding one of them. Afterwards a number of weapons were seized. No fatalities.
On 1 September 2020, in Cayey, Cayey, a man was held by several people and shot in the stomach. They also shot at his girlfriend but missed her. No fatalities.

Around 1 September 2020 (as reported), in Coamo, Coamo, two men were killed and their bodies were found in front of a housing complex. The car of one of the victims was found nearby and inside there were weapons and drugs. 2 fatalities.
Around 30 August 2020 (as reported), in San Juan, San Juan, a man was killed and his tied up body was found. He was tied up with an electrical cord around his neck and torso. 1 fatality.
On 29 August 2020, in Aruz, Juana Diaz, a man was shot in the shoulder by a gunman in a drive-by shooting. No fatalities.

On 28 August 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, police found $27 million USD in a boat. The police say the money likely originate from drug money dealing meant to be smuggled out of the country to be laundered. It remained unknown whether the drugs were sold in Puerto Rico or in the US. This was the largest cash money seized in the history of Puerto Rico.
On 25 August 2020, in Loiza, Loiza, a man was shot at by a man from a moving car in a drive-by shooting. He was hit in the hand. No fatalities.

On 25 August 2020, in San Juan, San Juan, various gunmen armed with long rifles and handguns shot and killed a man at a gas station. In total nearly 75 shots were recorded. The gunmen then fled in a vehicle. 1 fatality.
On 24 August 2020, in Gurabo, Gurabo, a man was shot and injured by a gunman who opened fire in a drive-by shooting. No motive is reported. No fatalities.
On 17 August 2020, in Ponce, a man was walking down the street when a car pulled up. Its occupants opened fire in a drive-by shooting. The man was injured in the leg. No fatalities.
Around 12 August 2020 (as reported), in Ponce, police found and seized 1000 marihuana plants as well as firearms and a sum of money in a farmhouse in the El Real neighbourhood. Two men were arrested.

On 9 August 2020, in San Juan, a group of protesters blocked the highway exit leading to the airport. The protesters demanded that the government take measures limiting entry in the country, fearing the spread of the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 4 August 2020, in Carolina, two gunmen shot two men and injured two women. One of the victims had a history of drugs and gun related crimes. Police arrested the two men, one of whom is a federal fugitive. 2 fatalities.
On 3 August 2020, in Manati, several armed men opened fire on a man in the town square and then chased him while he attempted to get away. During the chase they managed to kill him. 1 fatality.
Around 2 August 2020 (as reported), in San Juan, a man was killed and his partially burned body was later discovered. 1 fatality.

On 1 August 2020, in San Juan, armed men in a van chased two armed men on a motorcycle and shot them, killing one and injuring the other (drive-by). The injured man later died of his injuries in the hospital. The shooting was likely connected to drug trafficking. 2 fatalities.

On 15 July 2020, in San Juan city, a group of active and retired workers of the Electric Energy Authority (AEE) staged a demonstration in Santurce sector, against the consortium given to LUMA energy, claiming that it would rise electricity prices, create labor instability and will dismantle the withdrawal system. [size=no report]
On 13 July 2020, in Manati city, in Playa Los Tubos, a man was beat up and injured with a pipe by 4 assailants. The reason of the assault are unknown.
On 12 July 2020, in Santa Isabel city, a man was beat up and injured in Rincon Taino residential area by 5 assailants. The reasons behind the assault are unknown.
Vi Free Press; El Vocero de Puerto Rico

On 12 July 2020, in Ponce City, a gang member was shot and killed in a drive-by in Gandara Residential sector, presumably in a vengeance committed by another gang. The victim allegedly killed another man in an earlier event. The victim was in a car with 2 children and the children's mother. 1 of the children was killed and the mother and the other kid were injured. 2 Fatalities
On 11 July 2020, in San Juan, protesters interrupted a function of the island's governor. They shouted at her that she was corrupt and told her to resign. [size=no report]
On 10 July 2020, in San Juan, residents protested in the city center demanding that the governor of the island step down over accusations of abuse of power. [size=no report]
On 8 July 2020, in Caguas, four men were shot and injured by gunmen in a drive-by shooting. The victims were heavily armed themselves. No fatalities.
On 8 July 2020, in San Juan, residents protested in the city center demanding that the governor of the island step down over accusations of abuse of power. [size=no report]

On 4 July 2020, in San Juan, dozens of members of the Council for the Defense of Indigenous Rights, Taino people and other inhabitants of the islands marched through the capital to demand that statues of colonial figures such as Christopher Colombus to be taken down. [size=dozens]

On 26 June 2020, in San Juan, employees of the treasury protested to ask for bonuses to be paid to them for their work while the rest of the country was in lockdown due to coronavirus. [size=no report]
Around 23 June 2020 (as reported), in Gurabo, a man was killed with gunshots. His gagged and partially burnt body was later discovered in the Celada neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 21 June 2020, in Cayey, three men were shot and injured in a drive-by shooting. All three were brought to the hospital in stable condition. No fatalities.
On 18 June 2020, in San Juan, workers of the MST gathered at the Santurce Center for Fine Arts to call for the introduction of a policy to protect workers during coronavirus. [size=no report]
Around 18 June 2020, in Levittown, Toa Baja, two men were killed with gunshots. Their bodies were after found tied up in a car. The police have not yet identified the men. 2 fatalities.

On 17 June 2020, in San Juan, a group of students who attend Montessori schools and their parents protested in front of the Capitol building. The protesters asked the government to introduce legislation that would allow for more regulation of Montessori schools in the country. [size=no report]
On 15 June 2020, in Guayama, a man was shot and injured in his car. He was sitting at an intersection when various individuals approached his car and shot him. 0 fatalities.

On 14 June 2020, in San Juan, San Juan-Laventille, a man was shot dead while driving a car. The police believe a number of armed men started chasing him in a car and when the victim lost control over the wheel opened fire, killing him. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2020, in San Juan, unknown individuals shot at the building of the Puerto Rico Athenaeum, a cultural institution located next to the Capitol building. The building suffered some damage. It is not known who was the culprit or what the motive was.

On 14 June 2020, in San Juan, various protests were held. One of about 100 dentists was held in front of the Capitol building, and another of 60 young people who call themselves the 'Imperialistas'. The reason for protesting was merely reported as 'to reclaim rights'. [size=about 160]
On 11 June 2020, off the coast of Vieques, police found over 2 million dollars in cash floating in duffel bags, apparently thrown from a boat into the sea.
On 9 June 2020, off the coast of Aguada, maritime police stopped a boat with 38 undocumented people on board and detained them.

On 8 June 2020, in San Juan, teachers of the Federation of Teachers protested in front of the Capitol in support of a bill that was being discussed. The bill would prevent further budget cuts to education. [size=no report]
On 6 June 2020, in Bayamon, an armed clash between occupants of two cars resulted in the death of one man and another being injured. 1 fatality.
On 6 June 2020, in Vieques, dozens of people gathered for a protest in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement. [size=dozens]
On 5 June 2020, in San Juan, two men were shot in a drive-by shooting in Caimito. One man was injured and the other died. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2020, in San Juan, a demonstration of about 120 people near the Executive Palace escalated when demonstrators started throwing objects at police officers. Two officers were attacked and had to be brought to the hospital. [size=about 120]

On 1 June 2020, in San Juan, one of the persons of interest in the killing of a girl and her mother on the 21st of May of this year was shot 8 times. The victim was a known criminal and had been sentenced for another murder earlier. 0 fatalities.
On 27 May 2020, in Bayamon, a man died and another was injured after they were shot at by armed men from a bus in the Campo Allegre neighbourhood. The two men were from the Dominican Republic.

Around 26 May 2020, in San Juan city, protesters --including prosecutors and relatives of murder victims-- gathered outside of the capitol to protest against a change in law. The change would entail that guilty verdicts by jury need to be unanimous. The proposal to make this change retroactive sparked protests as it would set free those who were convicted non-unanimously for murder. [size=no report]
Around 26 May 2020, in San Juan, a man was killed. His body was found with gunshot wounds and his hands tied together. 1 fatality.

On 25 May 2020, in San Juan, a man was shot and killed while driving his car in Blodet in the Hato Rey neighbourhood. The gunmen shot from another driving car in a drive-by shooting. The victim had no criminal record. 1 fatality.
On 25 May 2020, in San Juan, dozens of health technicians protested in front of the Capitol building, asking for recognition of their work during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=dozens]

On 23 May 2020, in Carolina, three men were shot with automatic weapons and killed from a moving car in a drive-by shooting in Villa la Marina. A fourth man escaped unharmed. The victims were armed and had a history of drug crime. 3 fatalities.

On 21 May 2020, in Anasco, a woman and a child were killed in a drive-by shooting. Police speculate that the shooting was related to narcotrafficking. A man who was present at the scene but remained uninjured was later arrested. 2 fatalities.
Police Forces of the United States (2017-) Drug Enforcement Administration
On 19 May 2020, in Rio Grande, the house of an agent of the Drug Enforcement Administration in the Jimenez neighbourhood was shot at while the agent was standing on the balcony. 0 fatalities.
On 19 May 2020, in Anasco, a man was shot and wounded by gunmen in a drive-by shooting in Carreras neighbourhood. 0 fatalities.

On 19 May 2020, in San Juan city, two men were killed in the Santurce neighbourhood. Police believe the killing is connected to the seizure of two kilogrammes of cocaine the day before. According to the police a third person managed to escape. 2 fatalities.
Police Forces of the United States (2017-) Drug Enforcement Administration
On 18 May 2020, in Rio Grande, the house of an agent of the Drug Enforcement Administration in the Jimenez neighbourhood was shot at. 0 fatalities.
Around 17 May 2020 in Hato Nuevo, Gurabo, a man was killed and his body was found in a car with gunshot wounds and his hands tied. 1 fatality.
Around 17 May 2020, in Quebrada Arenas, Vega Baja, a man was killed and his body was found in the trunk of a burning car. The body was partially burnt and had gunshot wounds. 1 fatality.

On 16 May 2020, in San Juan city, a barber was cutting the hair of his brother in law in Residencial San Fernando, when a number of armed men shot and killed him. Nearly 50 bullet casings were found at the scene. None of those present - including the brother-in-law - claimed to have seen anything. 1 fatality.
On 16 May 2020, in San Juan city, women gathered to protest, demanding the opening of the beaches which are closed because of coronavirus. [size=no report]
Around 14 May 2020 (as reported), in San Juan city, protesters in cars drove to the old town to demand that more coronavirus tests should be carried out by the government. [size=no report]
On 5 May 2020, in Ponce city, three apartments which were used to stash weapons and drugs by drug traffickers were set on fire by unknown individuals.

On 5 May 2020, in Vieques city, police officers confronted a group of hitmen who were planning to assassinate a target, resulting in a shoot-out between the two groups. One hitman was arrested. 0 fatalities reported.
On 2 May 2020, in Yauco, men in a car opened fire on a housing complex in a drive-by shooting. No injuries reported.
O 2 May 2020, in Loiza, men in a car opened fire, injuring three people (drive-by). No fatalities reported.
On 2 May 2020, in Yauco, police officers witnessed men shooting at a housing complex. When they intervened, the men in the car opened fire at the police, injuring 4. No fatalities reported.
On 1 May 2020, in Ceiba, Fajardo, a man was shot and killed by two individuals in a drive-by shooting. The motive is unknown. 1 fatality.
Health Workers (Puerto Rico); Labour Group (Puerto Rico)

On 1 May 2020, in San Juan, workers drove through the city to commemorate International Workers Day. Among the protesters were nurses demanding better working conditions in light of the coronavirus crisis. [size=no report]
On 30 April 2020, in San Juan city, a police officer was shot by unidentified gunmen. 0 fatalities.

On 30 April 2020, in San Juan, a protest known as Caravana por la vida was organized. The protesters demanded more coronavirus testing. The police intervened in the protest and arrested one of the leaders. [size=no report]
On 29 April 2020, in Caguas, a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

On 29 April 2020, in San Juan, four individuals on motorcycles opened fire at the police station in Puerta de Tierra neighbourhood in a drive-by shooting. A police officer returned fire and hit two of the individuals. No fatalities reported.
On 27 April 2020, in an industrial area outside of Humacao, a man was shot and wounded in a drive-by shooting. No fatalities reported.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
On 22 April 2020, in Humacao, the bodies of two transsexual women were found burned in a car. 2 fatalities.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
On 20 April 2020, in Arecibo, the bodies of three people were burned in a car. The police found bullet casings at the scene and thus suspects that the three were executed there. 3 fatalities.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico

On 15 April 2020, in San Juan, in front of the office of television station WIPR in Hato Rey neighbourhood protesters asked the government for more testing for the coronavirus to be done on the island. The protesters stayed in their cars but chanted and put signs out of their windows. [size=a large group]
On 4 April 2020, in Carolina, Puerto Rico, a plastic bag with human remains in it was found. It is not clear when the person was killed. 1 fatality
Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

On 2 April 2020, off the coast of Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico, agents of the US Customs and Border Patrol interepted a boat with 35 undocumented persons from Haiti and the Dominican Republic who were trying to enter Puerto Rico illegally.
On 1 April 2020, in Hato Rey neighbourhood, San Juan, a man was shot by a group of armed men who drove away. He died in the hospital later.
On 31 March 2020, in Trujillo Alto, gunmen shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting.
On 29 March 2020, in Canovanas, Puerto Rico, gunmen drove up to a house and shot at it in a drive-by shooting, killing one and wounding two. The man who was killed had a history of drug-crimes.

On 18 March 2020, in Fajardo, Puerto Rico, various armed men shot and killed a woman and wounded two others. It is believed that they attempted to kill another man who lived in the same building. 1 fatality.

On 7 August 2018, in Arecibo, Arecibo, gunmen shot a man from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting. The man was injured. No fatalities.
On 6 August 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), a protest was staged by dozens of citizens to reject violence against women and femicides in Puerto Rico in the Hato Rey neighborhood. [size=dozens]

On 5 August 2018, in Cidra, Cidra, two people were killed in a shooting in a parking lot. One of the victims was a known drug dealer who controlled the marihuana business in the region according to police. This man was also a suspect in a number of murder cases. 2 fatalities.
On 2 August 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), one of the most powerful drug dealers in the area was shot and killed. The armed clash took place in the Cantera sector, Santurce. 1 fatality,

On 30 July 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen shot and injured a man from a moving vehicle (drive-by) in the Puerto Nuevo neighbourhood. Casings of two different calibres were found at the scene by investigators. No fatalities.
On 29 July 2018, in Vega Baja (Vega Baja), a woman was shot and killed by unidentified armed men from a moving vehicle (drive-by) in Carrapa Heights neighborhood. 1 fatality.
On 28 July 2018, in Mayaguez, Mayaguez, gunmen shot at two men walking on the sidewalk from a moving vehicle (drive-by), hitting one in the back. The man was taken to the hospital. No fatalities.
On 25 July 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, protesters gathered in front of the Federal Court to demand that the government release more information about the public debt. [size=no report]

On 19 July 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), a protest was staged by dozens of teachers, students, and their families to reject the closing of public schools. The protest took place in the Hato Rey sector, in front of the Education Department. [size=dozens]

On 18 July 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, residents from communities that surround the Cano Martin Pena channel held a protest to ask for allocation of funds for the dredging of this body of water. The residents are upset that a $2,5 billion budget for various types of flood mitigation projects did not include the channel. [size=no report]

On 15 July 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a shootout broke out between two groups of armed men in the Rio Piedras area. Several men shot at a group of men outside a store who returned fire. The car in which the gunmen were traveling was later found burned out. Three men were injured. No fatalities.
On 15 July 2018, in Cidra (Cidra), a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed men from a moving vehicle (drive-by) in Bayamon neighborhood. 1 fatality.

Around 13 July 2018 (as reported), in Guaynabo municipality (Guaynabo), an individual was killed, burned, and the body was discovered inside a car on the road PR-174. The identity or the sex of the victim was not reported. 1 fatality.
On 13 July 2018, in Aguadilla (Aguadilla), a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed men from a moving vehicle (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2018, outside Caguas, Caguas, gunmen opened fire from a moving vehicle on another car in a drive-by. One man was injured. The car in which the victim was driving was taken by police who found an AK-47, different calibre bullets and drugs on board. No fatalities.
On 1 July 2018, in Ponce, Ponce, armed men in a car opened fire on another car in a drive-by shooting. Two people died and a third was injured. In total around 70 shots were fired. 2 fatalities.

On 29 June 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), the police arrested 50 members of the La Familia gang during an operation in the Figueroa neighborhood in Santurce. The police estimated about 97 people to be members and claimed that this gang was dedicated to drug trafficking.
On 27 June 2018, in Juana Diaz (Juana Diaz), a man and his son were shot and killed by armed men in a moving vehicle (drive-by). 2 fatalities.

On 25 June 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of young people protested with placards with the faces of several prominent people from the country under which they wrote ''I don't care''. They asked for greater attention to be paid to the poor communities of the island. [size=no report]

On 24 June 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), a protest was staged by workers to reject the cutting of pensions, as it was stated in the fiscal plan of the government. The protesters marched from the Plaza Colon to the Capitol. [size=no report]
On 21 June 2018, in Fajardo, Fajardo, two gunmen on bicycles opened fire at a man in a drive-by shooting. The man was hit in the leg and taken to a hospital. No fatalities.

On 21 June 2018, in Caguas, Caguas, unidentified gunmen opened fire on a police station from a car in a drive-by shooting. The shooting reportedly is related to the arrest of two men earlier. No fatalities.
Around 16 June 2018 (as reported), in San Juan (San Juan), a man was killed, burned, and his body was discovered in the Juan Bosch street. The victim was not identified. 1 fatality.

Around 13 June 2018 (as reported), in Dorado, Dorado, a man was killed and his partially burned body was later found next to a burning car in the Espinosa neighbourhood. The body could not be identified. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2018, in Guayama, Guayama, various attackers - including a man who is a known drug trafficker and who was wanted for at least four murders - attacked two men with gunshots after luring them in a trap. The men then put the victims in the trunk of a car, but the two managed to escape. After that the attackers hit them with machetes and ran them over with a car, before leaving them for dead. One of the two died in the hospital. 1 fatality.

On 10 June 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, protesters marched through the Hato Rey neighbourhood to demand the right of independence for Puerto Rico and the departure of representatives of the US government from the island. [size=no report]
On 8 June 2018, in Luquillo (Luquillo), a man was kidnapped by a group of 4 armed men and killed the same day in Carolina (Carolina). 1 fatality.
On 6 June 2018, in Cidra, Cidra, two gunmen shot and killed a man. 1 fatality.
On 6 June 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a man was killed by gunshots in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood. Police found his body moments later with his hands tied together. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2018, in Carolina, Carolina, a rapper and his mother were kidnapped by armed men in the Loma Alta neighbourhood. He was rescued the same day by police, who also managed to capture one of the kidnappers.
On 3 June 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen opened fire from a car on two homeless individuals (drive-by), killing both. 2 fatalities.

On 1 June 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a protest was held to express sorrow and pay respect to those who died during the hurricane Maria. Protesters put thousands of shoes in front of the Capitol building. [size=no report]
On 30 May 2018, in Cayey, Cayey, gunmen opened fire on two women sitting in front of their residence in a drive-by shooting. One of the women died and the other was injured. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of about 70 people protested outside of the police headquarters, calling for the resignation of the commissioner of safety and public protection. One protester expressed solidarity with two men who were arrested earlier that month by police who entered their property illegally, while another said she protested against alleged coverups by the government about the deaths that occurred during hurricane Maria. [size=about 70]
On 5 May 2018, a man was killed by multiple bullets fired by several men in Carolina, Puerto Rico.

On 27 May 2018, in Caguas, Caguas, unknown gunmen shot and killed a man. Police found 400 bags of marihuana in the man's car. Another person was wounded. More than 50 bullet casings of pistol and AK-47 calibre were found at the scene. 1 fatality.

On 26 May 2018, in Ponce, Ponce, a leader of a drug gang was killed by unknown gunmen in a car-to-car shootout. The killing was reportedly a retaliatory attack perpetrated by another gang for a shooting in December 2017 in which a woman and a child were killed. The victim was being threatened for harbouring the gunmen who perpetrated that shooting. 1 fatality.

On 25 May 2018, in Vieques, Vieques, residents protested to demand better health care as the local hospital has been closed since the passage of hurricane Maria in September 2017 and the repairs have been taking more time and money than expected. [size=no report]
Around 24 May 2018 (as reported), in Caguas (Caguas), two individuals were killed, burned, and their bodies were discovered in the San Antonio de Caguas neighborhood. 2 fatalities.
On 24 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, teachers, students and other protesters gathered at the Department of Education to protest against the decision to close more than 260 schools. [size=no report]
On 22 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a car with several men drove up to a man walking on the sidewalk and one jumped out, shot the man, and then got back in. The man was injured. No fatalities.

On 17 May 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), a protest was staged on the El Cristo street by more than 100 members of the LGBTTIQ community to demand a public policy that fulfils their need. [size=more than 100]

Around 17 May 2018 (as reported), in Trujillo Alto, Trujillo Alto, a person was killed and the charred body was found later in the trunk of a car that was on fire. Bullet casings were found on the scene. 1 fatality.
On 16 May 2018, in San German, San German, people protested against the decision by the department of education to close a number of schools across the island. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2018, in Ponce, Ponce, two men were shot and killed by a group of armed men who opened fire from a vehicle (drive-by). The police suspect that the perpetrator of the killing is a fugitive who was a member of a narco gang. 2 fatalities.

On 10 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, between 150 and 200 students of the University of Puerto Rico marched in protest against a number of decisions made by the board such as budget cuts and higher tuition fees. [size=between 150 and 200]
On 9 May 2018, in Loiza (Loiza), two armed groups clashed. Two men were killed and one was injured. 2 fatalities.

On 9 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, around 30 relatives of people killed in unresolved crimes protested in front of the police headquarters in Hato Rey to demand justice and greater effectiveness and diligence in the investigations, as well as more respect for relatives of victims. [size=around 30]

On 5 May 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), in the Hato Rey neighborhood, a protest was staged by around 30 residents in front of the police headquarters to demand the resolution of several killing cases. The protesters were the victims' families. [size=around 30]
On 3 May 2018, in Mayaguez, Mayaguez, various armed men shot at a house from a moving vehicle (drive-by shooting). No fatalities.
On 1 May 2018, school teachers in Humacao, Puerto Rico, protested against the closing of a number of schools.
Labour Group (Puerto Rico); UGT: General Workers' Union; PPD: Popular Democratic Party
NotiCel; El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico

On 1 May 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, during a large national strike and demonstration against austerity measures, clashes between demonstrators and the police erupted after the police attempted to change the course of one of the marches. Rioters threw objects at the police, after which they responded with teargas. 20 people were arrested, and a number of demonstrators and police officers were injured. Amongst other groups, the demonstration was joined by employees of numerous private and public sectors, retirees, the Popular Democratic Party, and the General Workers' Union. Thousands of people participated in the march [size=thousands]
On 27 April 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of teachers protested in the Hato Rey neighbourhood against the privatization policy of the current minister of education. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2018, teachers demonstrated in front of the Ministry of Education in San Juan, Puerto Rico, against the closing of almost 300 public schools on the island. A brief clash between the police and the demonstrators erupted.

On 24 April 2018, in Juncos (Juncos), two men were shot and killed by two armed men in the Ceiba Sur neighborhood. According to the authorities, the attack could be related to drug trafficking. 2 fatalities.

Around 24 April 2018 (as reported), in Bayamon (Bayamon), three people were killed and burned. Their bodies were discovered inside a car. According to the authorities, the attack could be related to drug trafficking. 3 fatalities.
On 23 April 2018, in Aibonito, Aibonito, a man was wounded from a gunshot after a gunman shot at him from a moving vehicle (drive-by). No fatalities.
On 23 April 2018, in Bayamon, Bayamon, students, parents and teachers protested against the closure of nearly 300 schools throughout the island. [size=no report]
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico

FADEP: Broad Front for the Defense of Public Education
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); Metro Puerto Rico

On 18 April 2018, parents and teachers belonging to the FADEP: Broad Front for the Defense of Public Education protested in San Juan, Puerto Rico against the closing of almost 300 public schools on the island.
On 18 April 2018, parents in Bayamon, Puerto Rico, protested against the closing of a public school in their community.
On 16 April 2018, in Dorado, Dorado, teachers, students and parents protested against the closure of around 300 schools on the island. [size=no report]
On 16 April 2018, in Salinas, Salinas, teachers, students and parents protested against the closure of around 300 schools on the island. [size=no report]

On 14 April 2018, protesters in Damian Arriba, Orocovis, Puerto Rico, protested against the lack of electricity in their neighborhood. A third of the residents has no access to electricity at all, while others experience regular power cuts.
On 13 April 2018, in Bayamon, Bayamon, students, teachers and parents protested against the closure of their school as a part of the closure of around 300 schools on the island. [size=no report]
On 13 April 2018, in Trujillo Alto, Trujillo Alto, two gunmen entered a home and shot the owner while he was asleep. He was wounded and taken to the hospital. No fatalities.

On 11 April 2018, in Vega Alta, Vega Alta, parents, students, teachers and community leaders protested to demand that the decision to close a school in the area as part of the closure of nearly 300 schools on the island be reversed. [size=no report]

On 10 April 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a group of students, parents and teachers held a protest against the decision to close their school as a part of a plan to close nearly 300 schools on the island. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2018, in Manati, Manati, armed men on motorcycles and in cars attacked a group of men who were standing on the side of the road in a drive-by shooting, killing three. One of the victims is the brother of a notorious criminal who was in jail at the time of the attack. 3 fatalities.

On 7 April 2018, in Comerio (Comerio), a protest was staged in front of the dam by dozens of residents to demand the provision of electric power. They have been living with no power for seven months after the Maria hurricane.[size=dozens]
On 5 April 2018, in Vega Alta, Vega Alta, three men attacked a man, beating him with blunt objects. The man was taken to the hospital. No fatalities.
Around 4 April 2018 (as reported), in Humacao, Humacao, a man was killed and his body was found in the Cotto Mabu neighbourhood with the hands and feet bound. 1 fatality.

On 4 April 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, several men arrived in a car in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood and one of them - allegedly a fugitive wanted for two other killings - shot and killed a man standing on the side of the road. 1 fatality.
On 2 April 2018, in Canovanas, Canovanas, armed men shot at a man from a moving vehicle (drive-by). The man was injured. No fatalities.

On 1 April 2018, in Luquillo, Luquillo, several men drew weapons and a shooting ensued in which 1 man was killed and 4 were wounded in the Juan Martin neighborhood. No information about who or what initiated the shooting. 1 fatality.
El Vocero de Puerto Rico; El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico)
On 26 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a protest was staged by workers to reject a labor reform made proposed by the State governor, Rosello. [size=no report]
Around 25 March 2018 (as reported), in San Juan (San Juan), a man was killed, burned, and his body was discovered inside a car in the La Riviera sector. 1 fatality.
On 25 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, three or four gunmen opened fire and killed a man in a revenge killing for another shooting. 1 fatality.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
On 24 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a protest was staged by thousands of residents to demand better gun control. [size=thousands]
On 24 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, two hooded men shot and killed a man in the Santurce neighbourhood. 1 fatality.

On 23 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, residents of the Rio Piedras area protested over the lack of electricity. Residents have been without electricity since September 2017 following hurricanes. [size=no report]

On 22 March 2018, in San Juan, (San Juan), teachers of the UPR (Puerto Rico University) staged a protest to reject the fiscal plan presented by the government. Later that day, students of the same institute protested for the same issue as the plan would entail higher tuition fees for students. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2018, in Morovis, Morovis, parents and teachers of a school that has been without electricity for 200 days protested to demand that this problem be solved. Many parts of Puerto Rico have been without electricity since September 2017 following hurricanes Irma and Maria. [size=no report]
On 20 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, adult students of a school protested against the sudden elimination of a number of adult courses. [size=no report]

On 20 March 2018, in Vega Baja, Vega Baja, police seized over 1400kg of cocaine with a street value of $38 million which they found on board of a boat at the beach. The cocaine reportedly came from the Venezuelan Cartel de los Soles.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); TeleSur TV
On 19 March 2018, teachers in San Juan, Puerto Rico, protested against the proposed educational reform that moves the schools towards a more privatized system.

On 17 March 2018, in Orocovis, Orocovis, dozens of residents protested for the third time this month over the lack of electricity in the area. The residents in this area have been without electricity since September 2017. [size=dozens]
On 14 March 2018, in Ponce, Ponce, gunmen opened fire on a group of people in a drive-by shooting. The victims were also in a car. They hit three occupants, killing two. 2 fatalities.
On 13 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, armed men opened fire from a car on a group of people in another car (drive-by). Four people were injured. No fatalities.
On 12 March 2018, in San Juan, (San Juan), various armed men entered a house in the Rio Piedras sector and killed a man while he was sleeping. 1 fatality.

On 10 March 2018, in Orocovis, Orocovis, dozens of residents protested over the lack of electricity in the area. Residents of this area have been without electricity for months since September 2017. [size=dozens]
On 8 March 2018, in San Juan, (San Juan), women staged a protest in the Luis Munoz Rivera avenue to demand the fulfilment of women's rights in Puerto Rico. [size=no report]
On 7 March 2018, in Arecibo, Arecibo, various men beat up a man and then shot him in the leg. He was taken to the hospital. No fatalities.
On 6 March 2018, in Arecibo, Arecibo, gunmen shot at a car from another car in a drive-by shooting. One occupant of the other car was hit and taken to the hospital. No fatalities.
On 3 March 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen shot and injured a man, after opening fire from a moving vehicle (drive-by) in the Rio Piedras neighbourhood. No fatalities.
Around 2 March 2018 (as reported), in Canovanas, Canovanas, a man was killed by gunmen and his charred body was found in the trunk of a burning vehicle which was dumped along the highway. 1 fatality.

On 1 March 2018, in Orocovis (Orocovis), a protest was staged by residents of the outskirts of Ortiga to demand the provision of water and electricity in their houses. They also rejected the fact that debris was still in their neighborhoods. All of these events were consequences of the Maria hurricane, which happened five months earlier. [size=no report]

Around 26 February 2018 (as reported), in San Juan, San Juan, a man was killed and his body was later found in the Rio Piedras neighborhood. His body was found in his car, in which police also found 4kg of cocaine. 1 fatality.

On 26 February 2018, in Comerio, Comerio, residents protested to express their outrage over the killing of five people in gang shooting two days before claiming that the lack of electricity makes such crimes easier. [size=no report[
Around 25 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a man was killed and his burned body was later found in Cupey. 1 fatality.
AP; El Vocero de Puerto Rico

On 24 February 2018, in Comerio, (Comerio), various gang members shot from a vehicle (drive-by) and killed five people and injured one man. The gang and at least one of the victims were involved with the drugs business. 5 fatalities.

Around 24 February 2018 (as reported), in Rio Grande (Rio Grande), a man was killed, burned, and his body was discovered inside a car that was set on fire in El Verde neighborhood. Another man was found dead next to the car. He had been shot. 2 fatalities.
On 24 February 2018, in Rio Grande, (Rio Grande), two men were killed by an unidentified armed men. One of them was shot and the other was burned. 2 fatalities.

On 22 February 2018, in Cayey, Cayey, residents of the El Torito neighbourhood protested against the lack of power. Residents have been without power since September 2017 following hurricanes Irma and Maria. [size=no report]

On 21 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen killed a drug dealer linked to a major gang in the Hato Rey neighbourhood. The man was linked to the killing of 2 men in 2010 and to several weapons and drugs related offences. 1 fatality.
On 21 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a gunman shot a man from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the Santurce neighbourhood, leaving him injured. No fatalities.
Primera Hora; El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico)

On 20 February 2018, people in San Juan, Puerto Rico, staged a demonstration during which 4 people were arrested and 1 person was injured due to police intervention. Rioters allegedly bumped into a police vehicle with their car.
On 18 February 2018, in Hatillo, Hatillo, armed men in a moving vehicle shot and injured two men who were participating in a parade (drive-by). No fatalities.
On 16 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, gunmen shot at a man from a moving car in a drive-by shooting. The man was injured but not critically. No fatalities.

On 16 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, dozens of teachers protested at the office of the Department of Education against a proposed administrational reorganization of schools on the island. [size=dozens]
On 14 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a gunman shot at a man from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the Hato Rey area. He was hit in the legs and taken to the hospital. No fatalities.

On 7 February 2018, in Barranquitas, Barranquitas, residents of local neighbourhoods protested in front of the office of the local Electric Energy Authority to demand that their power be restored. Residents have been without electricity since September 2017. [size=no report]
On 6 February 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, a man was walking in the Santurce neighbourhood when he was shot and injured by men from a moving vehicle in a drive-by shooting. No fatalities.

On 4 February 2018, in Ponce, Ponce, a man on a motorcycle and the occupants of a car were shot by gunmen traveling in a car in a drive-by shooting. Four people were injured and one was declared brain dead. No fatalities.
El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
On 2 February 2018, residents of Hatillo and Laren, Puerto Rico, protested to demand electricity in their community. The communities have not had access to electricity since hurricane Maria.

On 2 February 2018, in Bayamon, Bayamon, police carried out three coordinated operations in which high ranking gang members involved in drug related crimes were arrested. Police further confiscated a number of weapons, money and drugs. One of the arrested men was one of the main targets of the Bayamon anticrime plan which was implemented for the first 90 days of 2018.

On 2 February 2018, in Carolina, Carolina, one of the main gang leaders of the country and a federal fugitive was arrested as part of the 90 day anticrime plan. During the arrest some weapons, cash and a motorcycle were seized.

On 2 February 2018, in Naguabo, Naguabo, residents and store owners protested against the lack of electricity in the area, which has been off since September 2017. They asked for the Electric Energy Authority to immediately fix the problems. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2018, in Bayamon, Bayamon, police arrested one of the leaders of the Los Menores Gang, days after this gang was already largely dismantled by police on 18 January 2018. The gang was active in drug trafficking.
Around 31 January 2018 (as reported), in Guaynabo municipality (Guaynabo), an individual was killed and burned. The body was discovered inside a car on the road 174. 1 fatality.

Around 31 January 2018 (as reported), in Ponce, Ponce, two rivalling gangs clashed when one of the groups was seeking revenge for a prior attack. One of the leaders was injured, another one killed. An innocent neighbour was also killed. 2 fatalities.
Around 30 January 2018 (as reported), in Bayamon, Bayamon, a woman was killed and her body was later found near her car. The body was on its knees and partially burned. 1 fatality.
On 29 January 2018, in Dorado (Dorado), a protest was staged by parents of students of the Marcelino Canino school to reject the transfer of many of its teachers to another school. [size=no report]
On 28 January 2018, in Ponce (Ponce), a woman was shot and killed by unidentified armed men from a moving vehicle (drive-by). A man who was next to her was injured. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2018, in San Lorenzo, San Lorenzo, armed men with assault rifles opened fire on a group of men who were involved in the drug trade in a drive-by shooting. Three men were killed and a man and a boy were injured. Afterwards the gunmen set their vehicle on fire. 3 fatalities.

Around 24 January 2018 (week of), in Ponce, Ponce, a gangster tried to shoot and kill his rival, but missed. No fatalities.

On 24 January 2018, in Cayey, Cayey, dozens of residents protested in front of the local office of the Electric Energy Authority to demand that their connection to power be restored. The residents have been without power since September 2017. [size=dozens]

On 22 January 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, dozens of police officers protested to demand a dignified retirement and to demand that the governor keeps the promises that he made during his election campaign. [size=dozens]

On 17 January 2018, in San Juan, San Juan, various armed men opened fire on two men in the Rio Piedras area. Both men were taken to the hospital. No fatalities.
Around 16 January 2018 (as reported), in Caguas (Caguas), two individuals were killed, burned, and their bodies were discovered in the San Antonio de Caguas neighborhood. 2 fatalities.

On 15 January 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), a protest was staged by several mayors to demand the better functioning of the Electric Energy Authority (AEE). Many citizens of Puerto Rico had remained with no electric power since the Maria hurricane. [size=no report]
On 14 January 2018, in Cayey, Cayey, two hooded gunmen got out of a car and opened fire on a group of men in the Montellanos neighbourhood, killing one and injuring two. 1 fatality.

On 12 January 2018, in Carolina, Carolina, dozens of residents of a number of towns protested at the office of the Electric Energy Authority to demand that their connection to electricity be restored. The protesters have been without electricity for some time. [size=dozens]

On 11 January 2018, in Toa Alta, Toa Alta, dozens of residents protested in front of the Electric Energy Authority's building to demand that their connection to electricity be restored. The residents have been without electricity for 115 days since Hurricane Maria in September 2017. [size=dozens]

One of the men was bound by the legs, and all corpses had gunshot wounds to the back of the head and the face, leading police to think they were executed. Around 1 January 2018 (as reported), in Vega Baja, (Vega Baja), in the Pugnado neighborhood, a man was killed and found dead. The victim had been shot and burned. His identity was not reported. 1 fatality.
